problemSets.question: When you see a live stock chart, what are the prices being shown?

choices.answer: The current price of one share
The price of the next trade for one share
The price of the last trade

problemSets.question: Who must you contact to buy and sell your stock?
Which of the following is correct?

choices.answer: Market orders are for time sensitive orders
Market orders are for price sensitive orders
Limit orders are for time sensitive orders
Limit orders are for price sensitive orders

problemSets.question: Let’s say you want to purchase 651 shares of Company XYZ through a market order. Your broker receives the following information from the market makers at the exchange: Market maker 1 has 326 shares and is willing to sell them at _x. Market maker 2 has 125 shares and is willing to sell them at _y. Market maker 3 has 600 shares and is willing to sell them at _z. How much will you have spent purchasing those shares, before paying commissions to your stock broker?
hint: Number of shares to be bought from each : {651 - 326 = 325 (Purchase 326 from Market Maker 1), 325 - 125 = 200 (Purchase 125 from Market Maker 2), 200 - 200 = 0 (Purchase 200 from Market Maker 3) }
Amount Spent = 326 * cost per share from Market Maker 1 + 125 * cost per share from Market Maker 2 + 200 * cost per share from Market Maker 3

problemSets.question: Let’s say you want to purchase 832 shares of Company XYZ through a market order. Your broker receives the following information from the market makers at the exchange: Market maker 1 has 275 shares and is willing to sell them at _x. Market maker 2 has 350 shares and is willing to sell them at _y. Market maker 3 has 1000 shares and is willing to sell them at _z. What value did you pay per-share, before paying commissions to your stock broker?
hint: Number of shares to be bought from each : {832 - 275 = 557 (Purchase 275 from Market Maker 1), 557 - 350 = 207 (Purchase 350 from Market Maker 2), 207 - 207 = 0 (Purchase 207 from Market Maker 3) }
Amount Spent = 275 * cost per share from Market Maker 1 + 350 * cost per share from Market Maker 2 + 207 * cost per share from Market Maker 3
Price Per Share = Amount Spent / number of shares
